intro: Effusiella longispicata, commonly known as the long-spined effusiella, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, hairy leaves. Its flowers are typically pale pink to white, with five petals and numerous stamens. Effusiella longispicata is often found in moist, shaded environments and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
